snippet: Any political figure like Bill de Blasio, who came to power by the hand of moral authority and in possession of a big agenda for reform, is going to be judged more harshly than one who seems more obviously transactional.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City notes growing sense in some Brooklyn neighborhoods that Mayor Bill de Blasio has reneged on several campaign promises; holds that political figures who rise to power on campaign of moral authority and proposed reforms are judged more harshly than others, and that New York City lacks template for governing from position of economic liberalism; says these circumstances contribute to impression that de Blasio has compromised his principles; asserts that he has achieved several quiet liberal victories.
lead_paragraph: Any political figure like Bill de Blasio, who came to power by the hand of moral authority and in possession of a big agenda for reform, is going to be judged more harshly than one who seems more obviously transactional.

headline.main: For de Blasio, Deals, Drama and (Maybe) Progress
headline.print_headline: For de Blasio, Deals, Drama and (Maybe) Progress
